response.job_title: Postdoctoral researcher at Jean Monnet University
response.summary: Currently working as postdoctoral researcher on materials discolouring using supercritical CO2.

profile_positions.description: Working at RAPSODEE laboratory in collaboration with Arkema society and LCPM Bordeaux on the effect of ultrasound waves on the cellular morphology of PMMA foams.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

company.name: Laboratoire Réactions et Génie des Procédés

profile_positions.company: LRGP I Laboratoire Réactions et Génie des Procédés
profile_positions.description: Formulation of TPE filaments for improving interfacial adhesion with PLA for 3D printing and measurement of mechanical properties. This research internship is done at the LRGP with a duration of 5 months. Within the framework of this research, I work on the bibliographic part and also the experimental part. For this work, I have to find a compatibilizer to load the TPE and then extrude it to obtain a filament. Then the printability of the filament must be tested. Finally, the pure and loaded filaments were printed with PLA to test adhesion by applying mechanical tests.
profile_positions.title: Master Research Internship

company.name: Laboratoire Réactions et Génie des Procédés

profile_positions.company: LRGP I Laboratoire Réactions et Génie des Procédés
profile_positions.description: Extrusion of thermoplastic elastomeric filaments (TPE) for 3D printing. This work was carried out in the Laboratory of Reactions and Process Engineering (LRGP) for 5 months. For this project, it was necessary to produce filaments for 3D printing from a thermoplastic polyurethane elastomer. During this work, I had to check if the polymer was extrudable. Then, it was necessary to find the drying and extrusion conditions for the polymer. Finally, we tested the printability of the filament as well as the printing conditions.
profile_positions.title: Research Internship

profile_positions.description: Formulation of a dairy product with reduced sugar content. This project was developed in partnership with Givaudan ® over a period of 6 months. The subject was to reduce the sugar content of a dairy product. The challenge was to preserve the softness and texture of the product. For this purpose, sweeteners and technologies developed by Givaudan were used. I had the support of flavour specialists, dairy production and a sensory analysis team. During this work, I had the responsibility to find the right blend of sweeteners and technology to have the same sweetness as sugar. So I had to prepare the dairy product and ensure the same texture as the product with sugar.
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description: In charge of the quality laboratory. Developped all quality test for oils and resines. Customer care and engineering support.
profile_positions.title: Internship
